item.title: Setting up Japanese Input Method on Arch Linux with X11 and Xfce4
item.description: If you’re an Arch Linux user and you need to input Japanese characters, this post will guide you through the setup process. I’ll be using X11 and Xfce4 in this tutorial, and I’ll be using Fcitx5 and Mozc as the input framework and Japanese Input Method Editor(IME), respectively. Prerequisites Before we get started, make sure that you’ve uncommented the following locales in /etc/locale.gen: en_US.UTF-8 ja_JP.UTF-8 And don’t forget to run locale-gen afterwards.
